content.text: The numbers, words, images and symbols which do not bear a meaning, when standing alone.
Meaningful result obtained by arranging and processing data, used to make decisions.

content.title: Student Marks
content.description: Raw data (separate names and marks) is hard to analyze. Tabulated data is better. Calculated totals and averages provide useful information (e.g., rank, individual skill).

content.title: Human Figures
content.description: Individual images convey no meaning, but arranged correctly they represent a family.

content.title: National Identity Card
content.description: Looks like just a number, but analysis reveals meaningful info like year of birth, gender (0-4 Male, 5-9 Female).

content.text: Provide more other examples for data and information.
A combination of components that work together to fulfil a task. The computer is a system that processes data into information.

flow.Output: Name, Account Number, Balance, Cash withdrawal.
Time of arrival, Time of departure, Attendance record.

content.text: Find out details of items/books by analyzing their barcodes (Barcode and ISBN Code).
Not all information is suitable for making decisions. Information obtained should be of good quality.

items.name: Relevancy
items.desc: e.g., Submitting only highest qualification instead of all academic records from Grade 1.

items.name: Completeness
items.desc: e.g., Taking info from a small group for PCI (Per Capita Income) leads to wrong conclusions.

items.name: Accuracy
items.desc: e.g., Wrong info about a patient's health can be harmful.

items.name: Timeliness
items.desc: e.g., Today's weather report is not suitable for tomorrow's decision.

items.name: Cost Effectiveness
items.desc: e.g., Spending more than profits to collect info causes business loss.

content.text: Write another example each for the above characteristics.
Technology used to convert data into information and exchange them. It overcomes difficulties in data communication.

content.title: Higher Education
content.text: Online Distance Learning (Low cost, flexible timing, digital library, online assignments/quizzes).

items.name: MRI (Magnetic Resonance Imaging)

items.name: ECG (Electrocardiogram)
items.desc: Monitors heart beat and electrical impulses.

items.name: Cardiac Screening Machine
items.desc: Displays heart physiology and movements inside the heart.

items.name: Blood Sugar Testing Machine
items.desc: Analyzes blood sample for glucose level.

items.name: Blood Pressure Measuring Machine
items.desc: Measures BP at rest and during activity.

sections.title: Summary
content: Images, words, numbers or symbols which do not convey a meaning when standing alone are called data.
Information is obtained by processing data. Information is used to make decisions.
Computers and computer based systems are used to process data.
Providing data is called ‘input’ while extracting information is called ‘output’.
Quality of information is important (relevancy, completeness, accuracy, timeliness, low cost).
Data input, processing and data output are components of a system.
Technology is used to exchange the processed data.
Applications of ICT have made man's life easy. There are many applications such as e-Government, education, health, agriculture, business, entertainment etc.
The advent of computing dates back to 5000 years. Computing is categorized into many generations from the period of automation.
